intro: Acmella mauritiana, commonly known as the spurge or golden cup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bright yellow flowers that resemble small cups. The plant has smooth, succulent stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Acmella mauritiana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
